text:
I've been visiting this website for a long time, but this is my first review.  Just had to tell you,found this in the "Daily Recipes" section, took it home and made if for dinner last night.  My husband, a former chef, mumbled thru his second bite, "Keeper".  High praise indeed!  I took advice from earlier reviewers, marinated the chicken in worchester sauce, lime juice and garlic (NOT and optional ingredient in our house), left out the light corn syrup (never use it) and used a good stone ground mustand.  Found the "zing" some of the others were looking for.  I think the corn syrup is just too much sweet with the honey to stand up to the mustard.  Served it over thin spinich noodles, there was no leftover sauce.  This is on the menu the next time we entertain.  Thanks!!!

userID:

Display Name:
Rolanda

city:

country:
None
text:
This is the best recipe that I have made from this site yet.  DO NOT USE CORN SYRUP and try to avoid using regular mustard but use dijon. I thought about just buying an already prepared sauce but realized people were raving about it.  DON'T CHEAT YOUR TASTEBUDS. Make the sauce..it takes 5 minutes. Avoid use of a ton of pans.  I fried the bacon, drained some of the grease, sauted mushrooms in bacon grease, then sauted chicken (seasoned with garlic powder, salt, pepper, onion powder ) in that grease which added extra flavor to the chicken.  Pound the breasts (they will cook faster and the bac/mush won't fall off) and make sure they are brown to avoid having to bake longer. This recipe says to bake 15 mins but I took others advice and did 30 to make certain my chicken was cooked all the way. It's safer that way especially if your meat is thick (tastier w/ thin breasts). I think you only need about 1 cup of cheese. Two cups is a bit much (whole bag) for 4 breasts.  I made six breasts and I didn't use all my cheese. To avoid cheese from buring you could just add it 15 minutes before taking it out the oven. I baked mine with the cheese on and covered for 15 minutes then added more cheese,uncovered and baked another 15 or so till I knew the meat was done. My picky son rated this a 10. If you are serving guests know their tastes before trying this one but if they like bacon, mush, cheese...go for it!!!!

text:
Okay, 5 stars for taste, and 5 stars because we are still alive after eating this "heart attack on a plate" chicken!  It WAS delicious though!! My husband raved, and it takes alot for him to rave about something! I halved the recipe, only used a splash of corn syrup though, and didn't have onion flakes so I threw in a dash of onion powder.  Also, to me it seems silly to dirty a bunch of skillets when everything is going in one place?  So first I sauteed the mushrooms in a large skillet (come on, you have to saute the mushrooms! DONT put them on the chicken raw!) then when they were done, removed with a slotted spoon and fried the bacon.  Then removed the bacon and sauteed the chicken breasts in the bacon drippings instead of using additional veg. oil.  Voila - only one dirty pan! Oh, I also marinated my chicken beforehand in worchestshire instead of seasoning salt. The halved recipe fit perfectly in an 8x8 pan, still baked for 15 min.  Even though this is fattening, it definitely could be a company dish because it serves very nicely, just make sure you know your company's palates before making it.  Also, you could sub. a jar of already made honey mustard sauce instead of making your own to save some time.

text:
This was beyond excellent!  I didn't think it sounded too good, but since I had all the ingredients on hand, I took my chances and my husband is still raving about this dish!  I marinated the chicken first all day in equal parts worcestershire and Wish Bone Italian dressing with a chopped clove of garlic, then followed the recipe and it was tender and flavorful.  I also browned the chicken in the bacon drippings instead of oil. I also used two extra slices of bacon and used cheddar cheese instead of the cheese called for in the recipe.  I was surprised at how nicely the flavors blended in this dish!

text:
Yum!!!  :)
I made this the first time as written, and after later attempts to make this at least a little healthier, I agree with other reviewers that this is just as delicious using half the cheese and bacon.  I also like to double the mushrooms and throw in some baby spinach.  (To be fair, if you are trying to replicate what you'd get in the restaurant, the original recipe is more accurate.)
The honey mustard alone is worth 5 stars with a couple of tweaks:  skip the corn syrup, use half yellow and half spicy brown or dijon mustard, onion powder instead of flakes (more pleasant texture, and no onion bits sinking to the bottom).  I definitely don't *buy* honey mustard anymore!
Thanks Beckie!!!    :)

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I am in love with this sauce..How delicious. As I ALWAYS do with any chicken I make-I let it soak in buttermilk all day(1cup milk 1tbs white vinegar or lemon juice if no buttermilk on hand)-makes the chicken sooo moist.  Wiped off the milk and sprinkled with the seasoned salt and fried for 4 minutes on each side.  I would def do 5 minutes because I did have to cook in the oven for 20-25 minutes as it was still a little pink after 15 minutes.   I used 1/2 dijon 1/2 yellow mustard for the mustard part(for those that don't know what prepared mustard is- it is any mustard in a jar or container)I also coated the chicken in the sauce after browning and poured over the top before adding the mushroom, bacon, and cheese.  Didn't reserve any.   Next time I will cover the dish with tinfoil and cook for 15 minutes then remove tinfoil and let the cheese melt..that only takes a minute.  Great share-THANKS!

text:
Thank you for sharing this recipe, Rebecca!  This one is a winner for sure.
I am not a big fan of mustard, I used Dijon, the spice from the mustard, and the sweetness of the honey made an out of this world sauce.  Here are the changes I made:  As others had mentioned, I browned the chicken in the same skillet that I cooked the bacon in.  Also, I prepared the dish in the morning, (skipped the seasoning salt on the chicken)  instead I prepared the dish put all the sauce on the chicken, and put the entire thing in the  refrigerator, and let it set until dinner.  Then I pulled it out of the refer, put it in the oven, and baked it for about 30 minutes. 
TRY THIS RECIPE, you will not be sorry.

text:
I don't know what more I could say about this recipe. It was MAGNIFICENT!!!! I don't use salt in my cooking (cheese and bacon add enough) so I just sprinkled onion and garlic powder over the chicken. I drained most of the bacon fat out of the skillet and then sauteed the chicken in what was left (about a tablespoon). Once the chicken was out I threw in the mushrooms for about five minutes. I didn't reserve any of the sauce, but used all of it in the casserole and topped with pepper jack cheese for a little zip. Thanks so much for an absolutely wonderful dish; my hubby and kiddies loved it!!!!

text:
With 45 minutes till dinner, I discovered I didn't have enough main dish to serve.  My daughter quickly logged on to Allrecipes and entered the ingredients I had on hand-Chicken, cheese & bacon and Voila!!! Aussie Chicken appeared.  My husband pouunded the meat while I made the sauce.  My daughter diced the bacon and sliced the mushrooms and through them in a pan.  I sprinkled the chicken with seasoning salt, microwaved it until just pink, poured on half the sauce,spread on the mushrooms, bacon and sprinkled with cheese on hand.  Popped it into the oven and twenty minutes later listened to my quests "OOOH and MMMMM" over it.  I heated the left over sauce for anyone with a wicked sweet and sour tooth!!! and served along with rice and green beans.  What a great dish!  Thanks.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
My family LOVES this recipe!! When marinating, I usually add some worcestershire sauce. I also BBQ'd the chicken for a little added flavor.  If you don't want to BBQ the chicken, I suggest cooking the chicken breasts in the bacon drippings. It pulls all of the flavors in the recipe together and I have found that the chicken is more tender.  I also grate my own cheese.  I buy large blocks from the grocery store and grate them in the food processor.  The cheese is more moist that way and I find that it melts more smoothly. It might be one more step and may make the recipe a little bit more tedious but I think you will see that it is worth it.  I have made the recipe with mashed potatoes, baked potatoes, new potatoes and homemade french fries. A very good recipe for the whole family and for guests. Enjoy!!

text:
This is always a hit with my husband and kids.  I have tried several variations on this recipe, and this is a very good one.  This honey mustard sauce is definately definately excellent.  It makes all the difference to use this sauce and not a bottled variety.  I highly recommend flattening the chicken, tonight when I made it I was in a hurry and skipped that step but it actually ended up taking me longer due to the extra cooking time needed for the chicken.  I make extra mushrooms for me and my husband, and just leave them off the kids. Kind of a lot of steps, pans and calories, so this is a once in awhile treat for us.  Very good recipe, thank you Rebecca.

text:
Very good! A keeper! I didnt' use any corn syrup and it was still a bit too sweet, will cut down on the honey next time. I used cheddar instead of Monterrey jack. Didn't have onion flakes so made it without. Wasn't sure what's seasoning salt so used a combo of chimichurri (pepper + garlic + olive oil + cilantro + parsley + red pepper flakes + paprika) + salt, it was DELICIOUS! Since no one in my family likes chicken breasts I used 6 drumsticks and baked for 30min on 380F. Didn't like the bacon fat so I used ham slices instead :) I also left out the mushrooms since I needed it for the spaghetti. This is a very good recipe that you can make lots of alternations!

Yum! While I've never had this at Outback, my boyfriend has. He said it's not the same but it's still really good... I enjoyed it too. Served with some rye bread I had made and stored in the freezer (perfect!) and a homemade caesar salad (used Caesar Salad Supreme recipe from here) and we had a nice dinner in. =) I'd recommend using a mild seasoning salt--or even just S&P. I think that made a difference in the flavor... the stuff I used had a stronger that likely impacted this dish overall. Still, no complaints =)

text:
Husband couldn't say enough nice things about-- which means *PLEASE MAKE IT AGAIN!* Although we love mushroom, didn't have any, (and it was too cold to go out for some at last minute!), so used sliced onion, red and green bell pepper sautee to dress up the top. TURNED OUT BEAUTIFUL. Didn't have enough honey, so used PURE MAPLE SYRUP, which is little runnier and less sweet in place of honey and corn syrup-- but boy, did it make INCREDIBLE SAUCE!  Reading other reviews, used half yellow and half dijon mustard, and after searing pounded chicken in the same pan that cooked bacon, then veggies, coated chicken pieces one side using half the sauce, then flipped them, and poured the rest of the sauce on top. Arranged the sautee mix, bacon, and cheese for 15 in the preheated oven, then served with wild rice, spooning the sauce over the rice. Will be making it again and again and again... If you don't TRY THIS RECIPE, you're missing out!

I figured from all the rave reviews this had to be good.  It really was!  I freaked out at the calorie count, so I cut the sauce by 1/3 to make it not so harsh on the gut.  I also cut the cheese by 1/4.  (I realize I just said cut the cheese!)  Anyway, this was soooo good!  I served this on a bed of rice. text:
This was a really good dish.  I followed other's suggestions and marinated the chicken in worchestire sauce, finely minced garlic, lemon juice and lawrys salt.  I sauteed the chicken in the bacon drippings and added the leftover marinating sauce in the pan as well and then sauteed the mushrooms in the drippings/sauce. For the sauce, I left out the corn syrup and used onion salt. I didn't halve the sauce since I had 8 chicken breast and it was just enough.  I also didn't reserve any sauce, I just poured it all over the chicken and ovened it.  It turned out perfect served with spinach linguine.

This recipe was DELICIOUS! It was so good that it left my wife and I literally licking our plates. So, I made a couple modifications. I actually made this twice. The first time I made it exactly as written and found that the composition of the recipe lacked standard, although there are many such recipes in use. The next time I experimentd with the sauce. I still ket the same quantity of mustard by using one tablespoon of dry English mustard and three egg yolks along with one sweetener, Maple Syrup and blended them well, eliminating the Mayo. I grated my onions fine and used Prague cooked ham and eliminated the greasey bacon content. Worked well!

Beginner Cook.  Very Yum. I bought the family pack of chicken with bone (cheaper) and just cut the bone out of the thigh pieces. A bit more work, but not too bad for the price difference.  I added more mustard to the sauce because I thought it was too honey sweet. I omitted the corn syrup and the onion flakes.   I marinated my chicken with lime, worchestershire sauce, and garlic powder for 30 minutes. I sauteed my mushrooms first.   I baked for 15 minutes @ 450 (because of our old oven), and ended up having to bake at 300 for another 15 minutes because chicken was not fully cooked.  Awesome recipe after using review suggestions.

text:
This recipe was awesome!!! I altered it a lot I didn't use the corn syrup, dried onion flakes, parsley or the mushrooms. What I did was season my chicken breast like normal (steak seasoning) and let it marinade in the fridge for about 30 minutes. Then I cooked my chicken breast on the George Forman grill. I cooked my bacon separately. After the chicken and bacon was done. I poured the honey mustard sauce on top of the chicken breast, placed the bacon slices on top of that then topped it with Colby-Monterey Jack cheese and put it in the oven for about 10 minutes (until the cheese melted). It was awesome and quick. My kids used the left over honey mustard sauce the next day with their chicken tenders. I served this meal with corn on the cob and broccoli.

None
text:
Very tasty dish!  I can never find a package of 4 chicken breasts, always 3...so I cut each breast into two so I had 6 smaller pieces.  After frying the bacon, I removed it from the pan and then browned the chicken in the bacon drippings.  I cooked the chicken until it was almost done.  I then removed the chicken and sauteed the mushrooms in the same pan for about 1 minute.  I assembled each piece of chicken with the sauce, bacon, mushrooms and cheese and baked until cheese was melted and bubbly.  Served with garlic mashed potatoes and peas & carrots.  A hearty dish that is rich and satisfying.  The whole family loved it. However, the sauce was a bit too sweet.

text:
Awesome!  Here are the changes I made to make it lower carb: decreaase mustard to 1/4 cup; increase mayo to 1/2 cup; decrease honey to 2 TBS; omit corn syrup; add 1/4 cup Splenda sweetener.  My hubby and kids LOVED it!  I chose to decrease the mustard because one reviewer said it was too mustardy, and I'm not a huge mustard fan, so, I cut it in half. My daughter said "mmmmm, it's sweet and tangy!" before I'd had a chance to try it. Wonderful!
Feb. 2010- We still love this recipe, and I often make it for guests.  Soooo good!

text:
This was absolutely fantastic!! As suggested by others, I omitted the corn syrup and it turned out with the perfect amount of sweetness; any more would have been overkill!!  I did not pound down the chicken and found that I didn't need to; it turned out extremely tender.  I also sauteed the mushrooms in a little minced garlic beforehand, which went really well with the honey mustard flavour.  I wish I had put a little more cheese on it, but in the end, my Mum thought it was a little rich, but everyone in the family just loved it.  I am a Canadian living in Australia and YES, even the Aussies love this dish!!  Thanks for a great recipe, Rebecca!!  I will definitely make this again for sure.

Made this chicken tonight with some modifications. I omitted the corn syrup and added powdered garlic and powdered onions to a salt substitute and pepper and rubbed that on the chicken.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Wow! Yummy, Fabulous! My husband is raving over it! I took a few suggestions and incorporated them in this recipe. The honey mustard sauce was awesome. I omitted the corn syrup and used local honey and mixed half yellow and half grey poupon and since I was out of mayonnaise I used Miracle Whip! And I marinated the chicken in Worchester sauce, lime juice and garlic as suggested. I didn't have any fresh mushrooms so I used canned and saut√©ed them in the bacon fat! I grated 8 oz of the Colby/Jack cheese as I'm not fond of pre-prepared grated cheese as it is made with cellulose. I would rather not eat paper by-products! Also, if you buy your honey from the grocery store and not a local honey supplier check to make sure it is 100% honey. If you are having company, this is a must on the menu. You should be able to make this ahead and then bake it covered for about 30 minutes and the about 10 more uncovered.

Jackpot!  The dish was loved by the whole family, but I especially love the sauce and I will be using it in the future on seafood too.  I will never try another bottle again.  I used the Karo and substituted 1/2 tsp granulated onion for onion flakes. I sprinkled my chicken with a dusting of flour and garlic powder before browning.  Added a couple dashes worcestershire to mushrooms.  I will make this over and over again.

text:
This is a stunning chicken recipe!  Very tasty!!  The only change I made was to the mustard / honey sauce when I replaced the corn syrup with maple syrup simply because I didn't have any corn syrup and safe to say, it turned out great and very tasty.  May I recommend to cut the amount of ingredients for the mustard / honey sauce by half since personally, I do not see the need to have additional sauce being kept in the refrigerator.  The mushroom / Monterrey Jack cheese topping was fascinating!  I replaced the bacon with bacon bits.  To prevent the cheese from being burnt, I added the cheese on top of chicken about 20 minutes into the chicken being cooked.  Fyi, I cooked the chicken for 45 minutes at 360 degrees.  I served this great chicken dish with maple dill carrots and chicken fried rice and wow, what a nice combination!  The bottle of Chardonnay complimented the meal perfectly.  Congratulations to the creator of this very tasty chicken dish!

text:
This recipe was SO good and easy! I cut back on the honey a little, only because I had less than I thought, but it seemed just sweet enough.  I took the advice of one of the reviewers and used a little of the leftover bacon grease instead of oil and it seemed to bring out the flavor and give a nice savory balance to the sweet.  In a pinch, in the future, I might use Real Bacon pieces - just to cut out that step. It has tons of flavor, so milder sides - like steamed veggies and/or mashed potatoes are a good idea.  This is staying in the recipe box - A+!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Have now been cooking this for 12 years. Highly recommended as the ultimate prepare-ahead-of-time impressive dish.
Updating my original review from 7 years ago. Love this dish and have cooked it more than fifty times.
This is what I do: Cut each chicken fillet into 2 if small, 3 if med and 4 if large(cut through the thick end horizontally to make two thinner pieces). Otherwise the servings are too big. The pounding out is important. Forget corn syrup. Apply sauce before baking, but add toppings (and a little extra sauce) only 10 minutes before serving (or it all slides off).
I always double or quadruple the quantities as this freezes like a dream. I usually serve with new/baby potatoes which I wash and pop in a baking dish with a little olive oil, whole garlic cloves and fresh rosemary. Bake in the oven with the chicken. I then freeze the appropriate number of potatoes with the chicken (often in a pie dish). Great for the kids when we are away. I also regularly take it to my 82 year old mother - its her absolute favorite dish.
This is great for entertaining.Prepare ahead so no fussing in the kitchen. And everyone always seems to love it A LOT!

This was absolutely delicious!! I have to admit...I was lazy with this recipe.  I did not pound the chicken, I marinated it in honey mustard dressing for about 5 hours,put the entire dish ,with marinade, in the oven, and baked at 350 for 40 minutes. I normally don't like when people completely modify a recipe, but I didn't have all of the ingredients on hand.  Even the easy version is tender and tasty and would be easy to make for company.

text:
Very nice Some notes on my first attempt at cooking. 
I didn't bother trying to measure out the seasoned salt. . . as I trimmed and pounded the chicken I just salted each piece.  I also used onion powder in the mustard sauce since I didn't have onion flakes and I thought the sauce was great. I also left out the parsley. 
I served this at a dinner for another couple with kids.  Everyone, including some very picky kids (5 and under) gobbled up this chicken.  The honey mustard sauce tasted just like the sauce at a local restaurant that is famous for its honey mustard sauce.  Subtle, sweet but not too much, mustardy but not overpowering.  It kept the chicken moist.  I had the extra sauce on the table but everyone like the amount cooked on the chicken just fine.  
I also use the precooked bacon zapped in the microwave to make this easier.  
I will cook again and just loved it.

region:
None
country:
None
text:
WOW!! This is definitely the BEST recipe I've tried from this site so far!! I would give it 10 stars if I could!! I followed the recipe exactly and I wouldn't change a thing, except next time I'll probably layer the sauce on the chicken, then the bacon, then the mushrooms and then the cheese in that order. This time I did sauce, mushrooms, bacon, cheese and it was kind of hard to cut with the mushrooms in between the chicken and the bacon -- they kept sliding out everywhere!! :) Or maybe I'll try crumbling the bacon a little bit next time... that would probably work okay too. Other than that, it was PERFECT!! It was sooooooo delicious and it was easy to make too! I served it with rice pilaf and brussels sprouts. My hubbie informed me he wouldn't mind having this at least every other week and that's pretty AMAZING coming from him! Thank you so much for posting our new FAVORITE recipe, Rebecca! :)

After experimenting with this recipe several times, I took the advice of a previous reviewer and used the sauce recipe from Honey Mustard Grilled Chicken on this site. I was much happier with the results. I use a whole carton of mushrooms and a package of pre-cooked bacon. Add the cheese after the dish has baked awhile so the bacon can crisp. It turned out great. I serve rice and stir fry Teriyaki vegetables with this dish.

text:
I USED 6 CHICKEN BREAST AND LIGHTLY FRIED IN PAN. COOKED BACON IN MICROWAVE. AS I MADE MY SAUCE ,TO MY DISMAY I DIDN'T HAVE QUITE ENOUGH HONEY, SO I ADDED MORE CORN SYRUP. I USED 1/4 TSP. ONION POWDER IN PLACE OF ONIONS. IT DIDN'T TASTE QUITE RIGHT,SO I ADDED 2 HEAPING TABLESPOONS OF T. MARZETTI'S HONEY MUSTARD. I THINK I WOULD ADD MORE MAYO FOR A BETTER COLOR AND TO TONE DOWN THE MUSTARD A BIT. I WOULD TASTE TEST THE SAUCE TO GET TO YOUR LIKING.(NOTE: MIX MUSTARD AND MAYO TOGETHER FIRST BEFORE ADDING REST OF INGREDIENTS. I FOUND IT HARD TO MIX WITHOUT GETTING LUMPS OF MAYO THROUGH OUT SAUCE. I USED 1 1/4C MUSHROOMS AND THEY GOT LOST IN THE SAUCE, I WILL DEFINATELY ADD MORE OF THOSE.MADE A LOT MORE SAUCE THAN NEEDED DIDN;T USE EXTRA SAUCE. I ALSO BAKED LONGER THAN 15 MIN. IT WAS MORE LIKE 25 MIN. UNTIL CHEESE WAS GOLDEN. WE WILL MAKE SOME CHANGES BUT WE DID LIKE THIS IT MADE OUR TASTEBUDS POP! THANKS REBECCA!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This dish will roll your eyes back in your head, it is so good!  It should be called "Awesome Aussie Chicken"!  I did make a few minor changes when I made it, though.  I was out of bacon so I just fried some chopped thin sliced deli honey ham.  I used chicken tenders instead of chicken breasts and they cooked a little faster.  I sauteed a thinly sliced onion with some chopped fresh mushrooms in a little butter, to put over the chicken while baking.  Then I cooked the chicken in the same pan with a little more butter, rather than the oil.  I think the butter adds a lot more flavor, if you don't mind a little decadence now and then.  I also used shredded cheddar rather than colby-jack.  The honey mustard sauce makes the dish, however, and I didn't change a thing.  I'm not giving THIS recipe out to my family or friends so they can think I'm a super cook! :)  Thanks, Rebecca for an easy recipe that tastes like a little bit of heaven!!

text:
My husband and I just loved this chicken.  It was easy and so tasty.  I did modify it just a bit and saved some time doing it.  I cooked the chicken on the grill, sauted the mushrooms in the same skillet as I cooked the bacon, then assembled the dish in the same pan to broil.  I topped the chicken with some prepared honey mustard dressing, added mushrooms, then bacon and lastly cheese and broiled until bubbly.  It was fantastic will have again and again!!

text:
This was better than great, and easy to pop in the oven after church- I prepared the bacon (not done crisp) and chicken the night before. After cooking the bacon I browned the chicken in the bacon grease. Then I mixed the marinade and poured about 1/2 on the breasts,laid the bacon on top and into the fridge it went. After church I put sliced onion (cut into rings), mushrooms, arranged the bacon (one slice per breast) with cheese  on top(medium cheddar). Then poured the remaining marinade on top. This was a hit with young and old... even Shaina my 5 year old loved it. Tasted like a 5 star meal and looked like it too!!!

OOOhhhh!  So good!  The only thing I changed was in the method.  We prefer chicken to be more on the done side, so I cooked the chicken in the skillet as directed, and placed it in the oven with the sauce.  While the skillet was still hot, diced the bacon and cooked it with the mushrooms, in the oil the chicken was cooked it.  When it was ready, added it to the chicken already in the oven.  It was perfect!  Served it with mashed potatoes and asparagus.  Restaurant quality meal, with a cooked at home price tag!! Definitely adding this to the rotation!

We loved this chicken!  Even my husband who isn't a fan of honey mustard loved this.  The only thing I changed was that I drained the grease from the bacon pan and just fried it in that.  My pans can go from stove to oven so once it was browned I just coated the chicken, piled it up, covered with cheese and then it went straight in the oven. text:
I got home late from work and wanted to whip up something really quickly--this was an easy choice since I had all the items in the fridge. I don't eat bacon so I substituted for diced beef brats which I fried until they were crispy. I sauteed onions and mushrooms in the sausage fat. I sauteed the chicken in a little olive oil and then layered everything in the baking dish. I omitted the corn syrup from the sauce, and used deli mustard, brown spicy mustard, chili sauce, and honey. I only baked for about 5 minutes or so until the cheese melted. I served it with some roasted corn and asian string beans with cashews. My 7 year old loved it and he is as picky as you can be. My friend  thought it was amazing and I will definitely be cooking this again. Great recipe!

text:
LOVED this recipe!!! I served it with garlic mashed potatoes and it tasted just like the Aussie Chicken dish at Outback Rectaurant! I made a few adjustments... I used 8 slices of bacon (Two for each chicken),  sauteed mushrooms and onion in butter, used 8 oz of shredded Colby-Montery Jack cheese. I layered bacon (1), mushroom/onion (sauteed), cheese, bacon (1), mushroom/onion (sauteed), cheese. Then i poured sauce on top and put in oven. so i did two layers instead of one. And again served with garlic mashed and salad

text:
I use turkey bacon and green onion instead of parsley. All other ingredients followed exact. I cook the turkey bacon in a little bit of olive oil in my cast iron skillet. I remove the bacon and brown chicken. From there I proceed with assembly right in the iron skillet. I tranfer the iron skillet right to the oven. This is very good but although the chicken is tender, you will need a steak knife to eat this...if you try to cut in with your fork, all tthe toppings will slide off.

country:
None
text:
This was pretty good.  I followed the directions exactly as written.  The cooking time was perfect.  I would  not follow some of the reviewers who say to flaten your chicken breasts before cooking.  If you do this your chicken will be dry because A) your squeezing out natural juices that keep the meat moist, and B) because they will end up completly cooking on the stove because of the thin meat and then drying out in the oven. Meat should be raw in the middle by the time it enters the oven. 15 min in oven without flattening meat, made me some juicy moist chicken. Thanks!

userID:
3055025
Display Name:
Starlet
isPro:
False
followersCount:
3

141
favoritesCount:

recipesCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/100877.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This chicken is fantastic! Although it's best as written, it's easy to make it (slightly) healthier and still taste rich and delicious- LOWER FAT/CALORIE VERSION: Rather that use 'real' bacon, I chopped up turkey bacon and fried it very crisp, adding the mushrooms and some onion about 1/2 way through. Also, rather than fry the chicken in oil, I marinated it for about 30m in about 2 tb low fat buttermilk and 1/2 the amt of season salt for 30 mins before coating a non stick pan in fat free cooking spray. The extra liquid that comes off the chicken from the buttermilk combined with the spray is plenty to cook it in. You don't get that pretty golden fried look, but once you smother the chicken you won't see it anyhow, so big deal. Also, use low fat mayo for the sauce.  Again, once it's all together, you will not be able to tell the difference. I also use less cheese, just enough to cover is plenty to keep it all together, or I'll put a slice of swiss (healthier than cheddar) instead. With these modifications you can have an impressive feast without the guilt. Also, this honey mustard is THE BEST. I usually only make the chicken for 2, but always make the full amt. of sauce and keep it in the frige. Sometimes I even make just the honey mustard to go with other dishes, it's THAT good!!!

country:

text:
I made this a couple of weeks ago for my New Zealand boyfriend and my granddaughter.  I read quite a few reviews and merged them together.  
Here are my changes (although I think it would be wonderful without):
I used 6 chicken breasts so I used all the sauce rather than reserve any.  I too marinated them in lemon juice, seasoned salt, Worcestershire and and garlic but didn't have much time so only about an hour.  I crumbled the bacon rather than leave it whole (half?).  I omitted the parsley (yuck).  I only used 1/2 the amount of corn syrup (1/8 cup).  I do agree that it would have been much too sweet with 1/4 cup and I liked the sweetness.  Some may want to omit the corn syrup altogether.
Now, the weird thing was I had to layer rather differently.  My granddaughter doesn't like mushrooms, so I left 2 breasts without and my boyfriend doesn't like cheese (can you imagine?) so I left 2 without.  My 2 had all the fixins!  I loved this and it was yummy for lunch the next day.  Takes a bit of time to put all of it together but well worth it.  A+ from me - thanks!

text:
This is the second time I made this dish. I followed the recipe exactly, but didn't want to cook the chicken in so much sauce, so I poured half the sauce on top the chicken to bake the first time and froze the rest. 

I just used the second batch last night and this time it was better. I sauted the chicken in bacon grease, then added maybe 1/2 T worcestershire sauce and a tablespoon of bourbon, and cooked it until it was a nice brown color. Popped it in the oven with only a little grated swiss and cheddar. Served it over linquini with the pan drippings poured on top. Everyone loved it.
Next time I'll probably skip the corn syrup, or drastically reduce it.

Wow!  I went through the whole 'become a member' process just to leave a review for this.  I didn't use the corn syrup as I didn't have any, and only increased the honey by a smidge.  I think it would have been too sweet with the corn syrup, but it's all dependent on personal tastes.  I actually mixed up a tiny bit of the sauce first, just to be sure we'd like it.  It went over very well.  I have never seen my 3 yr old eat so much chicken.  And hubby said 'it's alright' which is great, because either he likes it or not, but he sure ate it.  Very pleased with this.  Will be making again, but not too soon on account of the calories.  Thanks for an outstanding recipe!!!
Update:  I have made this many times now, even with the calories.  I'll call hubby at work and ask what he wants me to do with the chicken, and he'll say "do the one with the cheese and bacon."

I had to try this recipe just based on the number of reviews. And it deserves all the rave reviews. Very Very Good and simple and easy to make. I took some good advise from the reviews and prepared the night before. I did not have any corn syrup so I just skipped it, and the sauce the great. Next time I will double the sauce and use some for the green salad!!!   The only thing I would change is more spice on the chicken, I do love the spicy and sweet combo, and here in Louisiana we like everything spicy.

text:
Awesome, awesome, awesome!   Here are my comments:  In my opinion there's no need to pound the chicken, as thicker chicken is juicier.  Some said on here that the "stuff" falls off if you don't pound it.  BUT that was not my experience as I didn't add the bacon, mushrooms, or cheese until the very end.  No need to bake the cheese, as the chicken is plenty hot coming out of the oven to melt it.  I also made a quadruple batch of this and froze some for the night's I'm short on time.   Oooo I can't WAIT until a night that I'm short on time!!  lol!

text:
This recipe reminds me of something similar I had at a popular chain restaurant that I really enjoyed (Applebee's here in Chicago).  I made this for my parents.  I didn't care for it as much as they did (they LOVED it, I enjoyed it).  The honey mustard sauce was the best part, although it is a tad tangy....  It is good enough to use as a dipping sauce for chicken tenders and I'll make it for that purpose.  Now, for the preparation.... I skipped step 1 and instead, marinated "pricked" chicken breasts (pricked with a fork) in Worcestersire sauce and a bit of minced garlic for about an hour (one of the steps for a similar recipe on this site - Alice Chicken) and then proceeded to step 2.  This dish goes well with rice pilaf and steamed broccoli.  I'll give this a second try, maybe with Bar-B-Q sauce (?).  It's definitely worth trying again.

text:
This was incredible!  I made it a day ahead and popped it in the fridge for dinner the next day.  Before baking, I let it sit at room temperature for about 45 minutes.  I baked it at 350 until it reached 170.  Since it had been chilled it took about 45 minutes to come to temperature.  This would be great to serve to company. I love that I can have it ready to just pop in the oven.  My whole family loved it; my kindergartener AND my 14 year old who doesn't like mushrooms.  I chopped them into small pieces.  He didn't even notice them until he was half-way through his meal. This is a keeper!

text:
I made ths last night and we loved it! I used about half dijon mustard and half regular yellow, and the honey mustard flavor was great. It was easy enough to make on a weeknight after work, and the comments I received were that a restaurant's offering couldn't be any better. I might use a few more mushrooms next time, since although it looks like plenty when you layer them on the chicken, they shrink so much with cooking that if you like mushrooms, you might want a few more so they are a little more prominant. I wouldn't change anything else. This is a wonderful dish!

text:
I'm calling this "Thousand-calorie chicken" in my recipe file.  It's sooooo good, but save up your calories for the day, because one serving of this is almost 1000 calories!  It's delicious as it is.  If I wanted to scale back on some calories, I would omit the corn syrup and use low-fat/light mayo. Keep the cheese fatty, though.  Who wants cheese on top of their dinner if it won't melt!  I will DEFINITELY make this again!@@@!!!

Based on the marvelous reviews for this recipe, I simply had to try it.  My husband was hesitant when I read him the ingredients but he was in for an amazing surprise.  He absolutely loved it, as did I, and he ate two helpings!!  I had some really thick chicken breasts so after browning them, I felt they some needed extra time in the oven.  They didn't.  Next time I will stick to the 15 minutes oven time!  Oh, and I added a lot of extra mushrooms (our favorite, you can never have too many).  Thanks so much - this will become a "regular" in our household!

text:
I made this for a second time, and I'm glad I gave it a second chance! It was terrific the 2nd time around. First time was OK, but the mushrooms were not cooked enough and everything fell over on the chicken after assembly -higher than the eiffel tower. 
The 2nd time?  I sauteed the mushrooms in butter with the chicken and I used store bought hormels real bacon bits instead of cooking my own strips-Sprinkled bacon over the chicken both before and after the cheese. It was awesome ! And the honey mustard sauce was Great. A hit , even with unadventurous DH.

I made this dish for my daughter's birthday.  Following other reviews, I did the following:  didn't use the corn syrup, used lime juice and worcestershire sauce to season the chicken and fried the chicken and mushrooms in the bacon fat.  I also baked the chicken a bit longer and applied the cheese for the last ten minutes of cooking.  It was delicious.  I didn't think I would like it but it was better than I could've ever imagined.  I will definately make this again.

I was so excited to try this recipe because my friend said it looked exactly like Alice's Spring Chx at "OUTBACK".  
So I made it and it was pretty easy and good. . .good if you want to feel what it is like to have clogged arteries!!!  WORD TO THE WISE:  I did what some other reviews suggested and fried the chicken in bacon grease rather than in the oil as the recipe suggests.  This made it taste unbearably rich!  I ate it last night, and now here it is the next afternoon and I STILL feel lethargic and unhealthy.  "IF" I make this again, I will definitely SKIP the "fry in bacon grease".

Display Name:
Grossman House

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674163.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe has some unique and special flavors and is a welcome addition to my recipe box.  However, I could see that made "as is" it would be a bit "in my face," overdone and confusing in flavor.  When I made it I served it over rice with the following modifications.  I used dijon mustard and eliminated the corn syrup and dried onions from the sauce. Then I crumbled the bacon over the top; used sliced baby portobellas and saute'd them with some finely diced onion before layering.  Finally, I eliminated the cheese and covered to heat in the final process.  BTW - I also took another member's suggestion and used the same recipe for 6 servings, layering the breasts by 1/2 in the baking dish.  A green leafy vegetable compliments this wonderfully.

I am from Australia and this is not "Aussie chicken" we do not eat anything like this over here, so im not too sure why this was called what it is.
What we would call "Aussie chicken" is just roasted chicken with a stuffing, thats pretty much it. Though this recipe does taste really nice, though a bit too greasy. Also another thing Aussies don't eat much of or cook, greasy food.

text:
I made this mostly as written with the only change being I sauteed the breasts in the bacon grease instead of using oil. This dish was out of this world! My family loved it and wants it again and again. The sauce is piquant in a sweet and sour sort of way. I'm usually not a big fan of honey mustard, but this was not the usual. This sauce is a unique blend of sweet and savory with an earthy goodness. Not a whole lot of preparation, which is good, too.This is a keeper, Rebecca. Thanks for sharing.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I used many of the previous suggestions:  I marinated the chicken with Worchester, fresh garlic and a dash of italian dressing for two hours.  I utilized a stone ground mustard and left out the corn syrup.  I also left out the onion and mushrooms (we aren't huge fans of either).  I added the seasoning salt, lightly, before cooking, and fried the chicken in the leftover bacon grease rather than the oil.  EXCELLENT.  My husband, very suspicious of new dishes, said it was the best chicken he had ever eaten.  Served with garlic mashed potatoes and breadsticks.  Next time, I may serve it over a pasta.  Would recommend to anyone for an easy dish with great flavor.

I followed someone else's suggestion and marinated the breasts in Worcestershire sauce, lime juice and garlic for about 30 minutes before the seasoning salt step. I skipped the mushrooms, just out of personal preference. The only other change I made was to use a store brand of "smoky sweet onion mustard" instead of traditional yellow. This was easy, smelled delicious while cooking, and was very tasty and juicy to eat. I will definitely make it again.

text:
I'd give 5 stars but I don't make it exactly as written, mine is similar recipe but I don't use corn syrup or the vegetable oil: Lowry's season salt, 6 bacon slices, 1/4 C mustard, 1/3C honey, 2 Tbsp Mayo, 2 tsp onion flakes, 1 cup sliced mushrooms, 2 C shredded cheese (colby/jack) or cheddar. Make it the same way except cook bacon crisp, remove bacon and use bacon grease to brown chicken. The rest is of the directions are the same.  Insanely Good!!!!

Okay ladies and gentleman, this recie is delicious, but I pretty much pitched the metod. Instead of 1/2ing the chicken I cut it into strips and marinaded it in worchestershire sauce like another reviewer suggested. I baked the bacon and saut√©ed the mushrooms with some garlic. After browning the chicken, I added the sauce (minus the corn syrup), bacon (crumbled) mushrooms and cheese, and let it cook until the cheese was melted. I served the whole thing over pasta with grilled tomatoes on the side. You can feel your heart slowing down whileyou eat it, but it's worth every bite! Cheers Beckie!

Rating:

dateLastModified:

helpfulCount:

userID:
4172584
Display Name:
Marionette84
isPro:

15
favoritesCount:
137
recipesCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677174.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
WOW! This was so simple (great for me!) and came out incredibly good. My fiance was a very happy man! I did change this recipe up a tiny bit to suit our tastes. I first pounded 2 chicken breasts, sprinkled with a small dash of salt and pepper and soaked it in Worcestershire since I didn't have time to marinate. While I was preparing everything else I just let it sit. About 5-10 mins. I excluded the mushrooms and onions since I am not a fan. While I fried the bacon in a skillet, I took 1/4 c each of a spicy hot mustard, a honey mustard, mayo and a tbsp of honey which I basically eyeballed then stirred. No corn syrup. I didn't want the extra sugar and it seemed really good without it. I browned the chicken in the same skillet after the bacon was done adding a bit more Worcestershire sauce. I then just transferred the chicken over to a 8x8 pyrex dish. I placed the sauce on top, then bacon, then a light hand with the cheddar cheese. I'd say 1/4-1/2 c. Then I put foil on top and baked for 15 mins. Took the foil off and baked for about another 10-15 mins. Just watching it to make sure it didn't over cook. The end result was fabulous and my fiance couldn't get enough. He's a bacon man so this made his night. Plus it's really simple to put together. Thank you for the recipe!

This was phenomenal but I did alter it by following the advice in Rolanda's review:  skipped the corn syrup, sauteed the mushrooms in the bacon grease, removed from pan and then sauteed the chicken in the grease.  I also seasoned the chicken with garlic and onion powders, pepper and the seasoning salt.  I had to use sharp cheddar as that was what I had on hand.  This was SOOOO delicious and hubby was very pleased with it too!  Served with roasted broccoli and a simple pasta side.  YUMMY!

text:
YUMMY YUMMY YUMMY!!!! I was in the mood for a mustard style chicken, and my husband wanted bacon, this was PERFECT!! We didn't pound them, just used regular breasts. My husband is also allergic to honey so we used the same amount of brown sugar, and we don't like mushrooms, so didn't used them. We also seared the chicken in the bacon oil rather than using regular oil. So flippin delicious!!!! And actually fairly easy, while the chicken "marinated" and the oven heated, my husband cooked up the bacon and I mixed up the sauce. Then we threw it in, and it cooked up really fast!! This could become a regular!!!! :)

text:
This is great! 1st off my husband is honest if he doesn't like something... I could eat eat chckin everyday but he gets tired of it and we've had it the last 3 days so I was hesitant to use up the rest tonight but this recipe looked like nothing I've ever made so I went for it! Glad I did! He loved it! As did I. I made a few changes: I marinated it for 2 hrs in Italian dressing; coated in a flour, paprika, pepper combo, then put in pan a few mins. Omitted the bacon completely. Sauteed onions and mushrooms for on top. Same sauce except no corn syrup, and my mustard was expired:) but it was still yummy! Baked at 375 for 35 mins. I used cheddar cheese atop as that was all I had. So delicious! I hardly had to rinse my husbands plate bcz he was nearly lickin it off! Thanks so much!

text:
I made this for my boyfriend on valentines day.  He loved it!  He wished I had made more of the honey mustard sauce to dip the chicken in afterwards.  I took advice from some of the previous reviewers and cooked the bacon in a skillet, then I sauteed the mushrooms & chopped onions (I didn't have onion flakes) in the bacon fat and some butter (i drained a little of the bacon fat out first so it wasn't too greasy).  This way only one skillet gets dirty.  Personally I would just use a honey mustard sauce from the store but my boyfriend seemed to like it better than the ones at the store.  So its just a matter of preference, I think this sauce tasted sweeter than store bought honey mustard.

text:
heart attack in the making, but very good.  I marinated my chicken in worchestershire, lemon juice, and garlic.  I cooked the bacon, drained it and then added the mushroom and sauted them with the bacon for a few minutes.  I omitted the corn syrup to make it a little healthier and used stone ground brown mustard instead of yellow.  It's an excellent recipe and although I made changes to it, I feel that the base recipe is worth a 4 star rating also, losing a star only to the fact that this recipe will kill you if you eat it every day.

I also grilled the chicken just because it was super hot out. I didn't use mushrooms because my husband hates them so I caramelized some onions in the bacon fat after cooking the bacon. text:
I've had the chicken dish at the well-known restaurant that this is patterned after, and this is absolutely MUCH BETTER!  This was so flavorful and tender.  The only things I did different were: 1. I sauted my chicken in the bacon drippings instead of just oil. 2. Instead of using colby jack (I didn't have any on hand), I used a couple of slices of swiss and some shredded cheddar.  Let me just say, DELICIOUS!  This would be one I would make for company. It was easy to make and very quick, but looked amazing.  I have to say that all 5 of my kids really enjoyed it, even the ones that don't like honey mustard.  Of course, I didn't tell them that's what the sauce was, and they didn't even notice.  This one gets 5 stars because it was easy and delicious!

text:
Amazing!! I did a quick version with what I had on hand. I seasoned the chicken with garlic powder and cooked it on the grill. I omitted the corn syrup from the sauce, used light mayo, and a little less mustard than called for. I didn't have mushrooms, so instead I sauteed half a large onion and a green pepper, both sliced thin. I omitted the bacon and only used 1 cup of cheese to cut back on fat. Threw it all together and broiled it in the oven for 2 minutes. It was sooooo good and much healthier than following the recipe exactly. Everyone loved it and I can't wait to make it again for company!

text:
Made tiny changes, but mostly stuck with it! Husband devoured it and asked if I could make more! He wants it for dinner again tonight. :) He doesn't like mustard so I was a little worried but apparently for no reason.  I left out the corn syrup, after removing the bacon from the pan, dumped half the grease out and sauteed 2 minced garlic cloves with half yellow onion (thinly sliced) w thinly sliced fresh mushrooms till just cooked, removed, used same pan to fry chicken on both sides, 4 mins each, little salt and pepper on the chicken w/ dash of cayenne, layered in baking dish, (chicken, sauce, onions & mushrooms, bacon) baked for 15 minutes @ 350, added cheese, baked another 10 and done! Soooo yummy.

text:
Hello!!! This was delicious!!! I made a few changes, but mainly stuck to the recipe. I used turkey bacon and after cooking it, I sauteed peppers, onion and garlic in the grease and omitted the mushrooms. I added some cayenne pepper to the season salt because we love spicy food! I then cooked the chicken in the same pan. By using one pan, you get all the flavors of the dish. For the sauce, I reduced the amount of corn syrup to 1 tsp. and used mircle whip instead of mayo. I topped the chicken in the dish with the sauce, then bacon and veggie mix, then Jack cheese! Sooo yummy! I will surely make this again!***Just made this again. Used bottled honey mustard, turkey bacon and pepper jack cheese...still absolutely yummy! Thanks for a great recipe!

city:

None
country:
None
text:
This recipe was great! I halved the recipe, though, because I was preparing for only 2.  After reading some reviews I changed it up a bit, though, and it was outstanding.  First, I marinated the chicken with Worcestershire Sauce and Salt.  Then I oiled up my pan and saute'd my mushrooms.  Then I made my bacon in the same pan and with all the bacon grease still in the pan I browned my chicken for about 3 minutes on each side.  For the sauce I didn't use the corn syrup and didn't miss it.  I put the chicken in the pan, coated it in the honey mustard sauce I made, put on the mushrooms and the bacon.  I only cooked the chicken for 15 min @ 325 degrees because the chicken was thin.  When it came out it was so juicy and delicious!  I served it with lime juice on each piece of chicken and sauce on the side.  Will make again!

text:
I was a bit leary of this recipe.  I like honey-mustard in small amounts and there was just SO much of it in this recipe.  I used probably about half the sauce (left the rest in the fridge to use for something else later), and it still seemed like a lot.  But it was really good and I was quite surprised.  I think actually the cheese made a difference cause I'm a cheese lover.  Left off the mushrooms since I dislike them.  Not only could the sauce be cut down, but I don't really get the point of the corn syrup.  Honey is sweet enough.  I think I'd leave that out next time.

country:

text:
This wasn't bad, but I don't think I will make it again.  Normally that sentiment ranks three or fewer stars, but upon rereading the recipe I realize a couple of the issues were my own silly fault.  I considered cutting the honey mustard in half but decided against it, and now wish I had.  I had an exorbitant amount of honey mustard, and I ended up throwing away the remainder because it wasn't tasty enough to save and use for anything else.  I apparantly confused the directions for this recipe with another recipe I was considering because I pounded the chicken breasts. At that point, I found cooking them for even just 3 minutes on each side almost cooked them entirely.  I felt like the various liquids in the pan diluted the flavors inherent in the dish, and simply adding more of the honey mustard did not solve the problem.  I also didn't like the way the bacon tasted after being sandwiched between cheese and mushrooms and baking for 15 minutes, but I don't really blame the recipe for that.  If I do make it again, I will just place the bacon on top right before serving.

text:
Great party dish.  I doubled the recipe, leaving out the corn syrup and saut√©ing an onion with the bacon. I marinated the chicken for several hours, in the honey, mustard, mayo mixture, reserving half of the marinade to use as a cooking baste. Cooked chicken, covered with foil, without browning it, topped with saut√©ed onions for 30 minutes at 350.Added bacon and cheese and cooked uncovered for 15 minutes more. I never did baste it with the marinade, so what remained I slathered on salmon the next night.  Baked salmon is the oven.  That was delish, too.
Review:

Display Name:
Kristina Godfrey

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/105419.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I worked at the restaurant this recipe came from several years ago and was quite surprised to find it here. It is one of the best plates found at the place. I have made a few changes to the recipe over the years. First I cook the bacon (either apple wood, maple, or hickory) as for the amount of bacon and cheese I  apply what I feel is best. Then I pound the chicken, drizzle with Worcestershire, season-all, and garlic powder. Saute the chicken and set on a sprayed baking sheet. I take the same pan wipe it out with a paper towel and then drizzle with olive oil. Once heated I add the mushrooms and cook until the soak up the oil and then add either Marsala or burgundy wine and cook down. Meanwhile, I make the honey mustard. The honey mustard, to me, is not worth skipping and since it is the same honey mustard used as a salad dressing at the restaurant this recipe came from I look forward to making this recipe since I know there will be some left over and that it keeps well (a couple of months). I also use it as a chicken finger dip. Instead of using onion flakes I use onion powder and this is put atop the chicken and served in little ramekins as a dipping sauce. This recipe is a crowd pleaser and my family loves it. So much in fact I remebe

Anything with mushrooms, cheese and bacon is going to get 5 stars from me. I marinated the chicken for several hours in buttermilk to help keep it moist. Then I lightly sprinkled it with seasoning salt before browning. I like to saute my mushrooms before I add them to any dish, so I did that too. I chose to use dijon mustard in the honey mustard sauce for extra flavor. In spite of the calories, I'll make this again.

text:
I changed a few things.  I halved the recipe and started out by marinating the chicken in 2 TBS worcestershire sauce, 1 TBS lemon juice and 2 TBS dried mustard for about three hours.  I left out the season salt.  I sauteed the mushrooms and cut the turkey bacon into confetti-size pieces before cooking.  For the sauce, I used a little bit of mustard powder and onion powder.  I also used part-skim mozzarella for the cheese.  Turned out pretty well.  Not wow-inducing, but I altered the recipe a bit so I can't speak to how it tastes going by the exact recipe.

Different and yummy.  A nice change of pace from the same old chicken, and my kids ate it up.  I had to use cheddar because my husband is allergic to Jack cheese.  I also omitted the corn syrup per the other reviewers.  I chopped my bacon up so I could disperse it on each breast and I thought that was helpful because you really want the bacon/cheese flavor with each bite.  That's when the best part of the recipe - the complement of flavors - really comes out! Thank you.  Will use again.

I followed the advice of reviewers and added some worcestershire & garlic to the seasoning salt/chicken; I wouldn't add the worcestershire again; I think there was a slightly odd taste that didn't go with the honey-mustard sauce.  I also omitted the Karo light syrup.  For mustard, I used half coarse mustard and half American yellow mustard.  Other than that, I followed the recipe.  I'm not a big honey-mustard fan, but my husband liked it.

text:
I used the old george forman to brown the chicken. i also used thick cut bacon instead of regular bacon(I chopped the bacon into tiny pieces with that magic chef chopper). I used onion powder instead of the onion flakes. When i layered it in the dish I made sure i got the sauce on both sides of the chicken. I then did a layer of mushrooms try and overlap them cuz they shrink and i ended up wanting more. I then sprinkled the bacon on top, then i drizzled more sauce over that, then i did the cheese.

None
country:
None
text:
This recipe tastes pretty good!  I've made it for groups of people and always received compliments from it.  The changes I made were small: I omitted the corn syrup the second time around (too sweet and syrupy), cooked the mushrooms before baking, made half the sauce, and used Dijon instead of regular mustard.  Also, don't overdo it on the cheese, this makes it rather greasy and masks the honey-mustard flavor.  I prefer to used diced onions instead of flakes.

text:
This chicken has a unique and wonderful flavor to it. As suggested in a previous review, I made only half of the amount of sauce called for in the recipe. I then saved just a small portion of it, and when the chicken came out of the oven, I drizzled it over the chicken. I also used raw, finely diced onions instead of onion flakes, and the subtle flavor of the onions permeated the dish perfectly! Also, I used sugar in the place of corn syrup (since I didn't have any on hand) and the recipe still turned out great. Lastly, I used all organic ingredients (as I always do), and this dish tasted awesome....one of my husband's favorites! This one's a keeper. Thanks for sharing.

text:
Yummy!  I'm not a big fan of mustard.  But the corn syrup helps to tone down the sharpness of the mustard.  I didn't follow the recipe excatally,  I was short on time.  But, it still came out delicious.  First, I didn't marinate it for 30min.  I think it was 15min, I didn't have light corn syrup only had dark on hand so I used that, and I used canned mushrooms, broied in butter- green giant brand, then I didn't even flatten out the chicken breast.  Oh yeah, I didn't use the dried onion flakes didn't have that either.  I used about a 1/2 tsp. of onion powder.  Poured a little bit of the sauce on the bottem of 13X9 in pan then put the chicken breasts on the more sauce, then mushrooms, then bacon and then the cheese.  My husband wasn't feeling very well tonight.  He said, "I'm sick and I still ate it".  Usually when he's sick he dosn't really have an appitite.  I highly recomend this recipe, very easy to make.  Now I want to try the actuall dish from the famous steak resturant and see if this is close, if not it's still good in my book....

text:
I had to write a review.  This recipe was unbelievable!  I served it for a bon-vayage dinner.  It was a bit time consuming but very easy to make!  I followed it exactly.  

I doubled the recipe and used 8 thin chicken breast fillets, one 12 oz. jar of orange mandarin honey, one 8 oz jar of dijon mustard, and 3 boxes of mushrooms which I grilled first.  I also used an additional 1/2 fresh onion (also sauteed) and added about 4 cloves of fresh garlic to the mushrooms.  I covered the chicken with foil in the stove for about 15-20 minutes then baked for an additonal 5 min (adding cheese last) until melted.  I served this dish with scalloped potatoes, corn, and garlic bread.  I can't wait to make this again!  I forgot to add the parsley the last second but it was awesome!  I hope this review helps!  Thanks for the recipe!!!

As someone who hails from "Downunder" let me set the record straight. Much like that Australian themed restaurant that serves only American food, the only thing "Aussie" about this chicken is the name. Honey-mustard is not a common or even remotely popular flavour in Australia. Having said this...the honey-mustard sauce wasn't too bad but the combination of this sauce, bacon, cheese and mushrooms wasn't a good mix. Hubby said it was ok and that he would probably eat it again but my son refused to touch it which automatically loses a star in my book. I don't think we'll be trying this again.

text:
Once again I have stumbled across an absolutely wonderful recipe. I changed things up a bit, but the honey mustard sauce was the same. I used turkey breast, cutting it into 5 pieces. It almost tasted like chicken and definitely looked like it, but was more tender and juicy. I sauted a little garlic and onion with the turkey in olive oil. I used the grease left from the bacon, mixed with butter to saute the mushrooms. Also, I did use cream honey instead of the regular kind, and a  mild mustard. Topped everything with Swiss and Gouda cheese. This meal was to die for, serving with roasted garlic mashed potatoes and steamed butter broccoli. Thanks a bunch!

userID:
1200195
Display Name:
paynes
isPro:

34

recipesCount:

reviewsCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/101158.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Amazing!  This is a great recipe.  My husband used to work at Outback and it met his approval!  I kept the same ingredients, but made a few preparation changes.  I used chicken breast tenders to shorten cooking time.  I followed others advice concerning the bacon grease.  First, cook the bacon.  Then saute the mushrooms in the bacon grease.  Then I set the mushrooms on paper towels to drain and cooked the chicken in the remaining grease.  This adds a lot of flavor and uses only one skillet!  I had very little clean up, which others complained about.  I also mixed the honey mustard ahead of time. (Make sure you whisk it!)  When I was ready to bake it took no time and little clean up!

text:
Enjoyable dish, my husband loved it.  It wasn't difficult to make, despite the fact I ran into problems.  For some reason, even though I pounded the chicken breasts they thickened up when I browned them, so the cooking time was longer than 15 mins, more like 30 mins. and even then they were still somewhat pink in the thicker parts, so into the microwave they went, resulting in cheese that hardened upon cooling,grrrrrr. I will attempt this again though because the sauce is divine and the ingredients all work together nicely.
UPDATE: I've made this several times since the review. It's a family favourite and great company dish, 
highly recommended .

text:
I was not prepared for this to be so amazing.  It was so rich, make sure your chicken is cut into small portions,  no bigger than a deck of cards, and serve with some vegtables and maybe some salad as sides.  The taste was amazing, I used dijon mustard and no onion flakes, other than that i did what i was told. My boyfriend loved it, and i think I will make it again for a special occasion, but it's not very healthy so it won't become a regular.  I think this recipe would modify into a really great  appetizer with cubed chicken wraped in the bacon with a mushroom cap on a toothpick cooked in the oven with the sauce and cheese.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was fabulous! It was a huge hit with my family. My husband, who has a reputation for being a strictly beef and potatoe man, enjoyed this and was telling other family members about the dish and how good it was. The recipe is very simple. Most of the ingredients are ones that everyone usually has on hand. I microwaved the bacon instead of pan frying, and as other reviewers did, browned the chicken and mushrooms in the bacon grease. I also added some garlic to the mushrooms. Prep and cook time were pretty short which was a bonus. I doubled the recipe so there were leftovers. The leftoevers were even better the next day. A really terrific dish. I will definitely fix again.

text:
I've made this before and loved it, but we are on Atkins now, so I had to tweak the sauce to make it Atkins-friendly (no sugar, so the honey and corn syrup were out).  I just made a faux honey mustard sauce.  I mixed about 1/4 Cup Canola oil, 1/4 yellow mustard and 3 packets of Splenda.  Voila!  The recipe is great for Atkins dieters (we're still on the induction phase and it's perfect).  Yummy yummy!  I cooked the chicken in the bacon grease and I sauteed the shrooms in the grease for a couple of minutes because I used fairly small breasts and they didn't take long to cook.

text:
This is a wonderful recipe. I did make a few changes after reading the other reviews. I used just a little bit of salt and pepper instead of seasoning salt. Then I sauteed baby portabella mushrooms in the olive oil that I used to sear the chicken. And on the sauce I used dijon mustard instead of regular mustard, left out the syrup and reduced the honey to 1/4 cup. It came out perfect! My husband and my kids all loved it.

text:
I made this tonight and everyone loved it.  I forgot to buy the mushrooms so used canned mushrooms.  I also used pepper monterey jack cheese since we like spicy foods and only used 1 cup which was plenty.  I cooked my bacon in the electric skillet, drained off the grease reserving about 1 Tbsp. and sauteed the chicken in this rather than the vegetable oil.  Probably isn't as healthy but it sure was delicious.  This will definitely go in my recipe book of personal favorites!

I followed other reviewers advice and sauteed the mushrooms in red wine and butter before topping the chicken breasts. Also, used no fat miracle whip and turkey bacon and cut the cheese to less than 1/2 recipe called for. Because everyone said how much extra sauce it makes, I actually cooked 6 chicken breasts with the same recipe. All the guests loved it!

country:

text:
This was delicious!  The whole family liked it, even my four-year old nephew (once the mushrooms were gone!).  I tried to lighten it up a bit, and it was still a huge success.  I used less cheese (I shredded a reduced fat version) and only four slices of low-sodium bacon (center cut-less fat).  I also substituted fat-free, plain yogurt for the mayo...no one even noticed and they were dumping the sauce on their veggies!  All in all, a marvelous recipe that's quite adaptable, too!  Great!

text:
The recipe is excellent though the preparation is more complicated than it needs to be. I use one oven-proof pan to cook the bacon, brown the chicken, the quickly cover it with the sauce and cheese and toss it in the oven. MUCH easier and a whole lot less dishes to do. Also, using a handheld blender on the sauce makes it much smoother and improves the flavor.

text:
Another satisfied customer here.  My husband, toddler son and I all enjoyed it.  Although it seemed pretty time-consuming when I read the directions, it went together really easily.  I made a few small changes.  I used a good bottled honey dijon dressing and added extra clover honey and some finely minced vidalia onion.  I also sprinkled the chicken with Spike rather than a seasoned salt.  I used some of the bacon grease in a nonstick skillet rather than oil to brown the chicken breasts.  MMMMM!  The chicken was very tender, which is not easy to acheive with boneless/skinless chicken breasts.  Thanks for a winner.

text:
Absolutely delicious! I modified a bit for two people - only used two chicken breasts and didn't halve, but did pound until 1/2 in. thickness. We bought marinated breasts from Wegmans that were brown sugar flavored, which paired well with the rest of the ingredients. I used half the amount of the rest of the ingredients, and didn't add corn syrup as I felt the honey would bring enough sweetness. It was perfect. Next time I'll chop the mushrooms into smaller pieces before spreading on top. Will be making again!

05/02/18: Made first time, per directions: Had barely just enough  ingredients; dijon mustard edged over the honey / mayo; despite that, I could imagine how 5 star this recipe is. You don't need the veggie oil or corn syurp.  DOUBLE THE SAUCE and use REAL finely minced onion.  Cook bacon first; use the grease to saute mushrooms, additional minced onion AND chicken breasts. Will update when I make again using proper ingredient amounts.

country:
None
text:
Made the recipe more less as written. Used onion powder instead of onion flakes and extra honey instead of corn syrup. I did as many reviewers suggested and cooked the bacon in a frypan, took out all but 2 tablespoons bacon fat and cooked the mushrooms,  I added the extra seasonings one reviewer suggested including onion powder, garlic powder, pepper, and paprika,  removed the mushrooms, added the extra oil back in, and fried the chicken.   I  cooked it for five minutes on each side in the pan and 15 minutes in the oven and it came out completely cooked. I Can‚Äôt imagine cooking it for any more time  as some reviewers suggested.  The key must be pounding the chicken breast to 1/2 inch thick.  Next time I might cover the pan with foil before baking and remove it for just the last minute or two.

text:
Made I tonight. I always read most reviews before i make any recipe.  First off..if you have a cast iron skillet USE IT.  I used by 12" skillet.  1 pan, 1 mess.  I marinated the chicken breasts in the Worcester sauce, lime juice and minced garlic in the refrigerator all day.  I fried the bacon, set it aside, put mushrooms in, saut√©ed, took them out and then cooked chicken.  Layered everything in the skillet, added cheese (Didn't use all 2 cups, and we Love cheese.  PERFECT!  If you want to lower the fat content, use turkey bacon.  I also used onion powder, to taste, 1-2 tsp., as it gives it a smooth texture.  Enjoy!

userID:

Display Name:
lallen
isPro:

followersCount:

madeRecipesCount:
1

recipesCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677176.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
It was very good. I made a few changes because our kitchen is being remodeled so I did this entirely on the grill. The butcher cut my chicken breasts in half so they were thinner and easier to cook. I marinated the chicken in buttermilk as recommended by other reviewers. Grilled the chicken with seasoning salt and at the same time sauted the mushrooms with an onion and bacon bits (the bagged bits from Costco) in a foil pan on the grill. Once the onion was softened, I took the chicken from the grill and placed in a foil pan, covered with the honey mustard sauce, layered the mushroom/onion/bacon mixtures and cheese (again followed the suggestion of not too much cheese). Cooked until the cheese was melted and served. It was delicious and no mess! Thanks for the recipe.
Review:

5

When I saw this recipe, I knew I wanted to test it before serving it to company.  Oh, my! It was fabulous.  There were raves all around. The only adjustment I made was to leave out the corn syrup and just use the honey as indicated.  I knew it would be too sweet with the additional ingredient and I used Grey Poupon Country Dijon mustard instead of yellow mustard.
I will definitely serve this to company...easy and fabulous flavor.

Emily Thoreson

text:
Okay, wow.  This should be called 'wow chicken', or 'the Jesus of chicken', or 'my-taste-buds-are-doing-the-cha-cha chicken'. Anything other than Aussie Chicken. NOTHING prepared me for the level of 'WOW' I was about to experience. In fact, there was so much wow that I am sitting here in front of my computer with a plate of chicken (Jesus-chicken gets that honor). If you make this how I made it, you will only be happy. Very, very happy... And full. Probably too full (but totally worth it).

I pounded away at my chicken breasts and marinated them in Worcestershire sauce along with a healthy amount of salt and pepper for probably six hours before cooking. Next time, I'll try to make that  a little longer and maybe add some other spices/garlic (always lots of garlic). 

After marination came making the sauce. We had no onion flakes, so I skipped that, and did everything else as recommended... EXCEPT I used dark corn syrup, and probably a little less than the original recipe entailed. Oh, and I used half dijon mustard/half normal. Even without onion, it turned out great. Bravo, recipe. 

Earlier in the day I had cut bacon into thin slices (I took all six strips and cut them into probably half inch rectangles). After they fully cooked to a nice, flexible texture, I took them out and set them aside. This created a nice bit of bacon grease for me to use to brown up my chicken. I probably fully cooked it in the pan, but chicken is forgiving, and I would rather it be overcooked than u

4

text:
This was a good recipe, something to change the normal chicken routine. I changed it just a little because I have a large family so I took 6 breasts and cut them in half to make 12 flatter breasts. This caused me to cut down the cook time on the chicken (frying & baking). I used mild cheddar cheese because that's what I had. I followed the video sauce recipe by substituting more honey instead of corn syrup but it came out a bit too sweet for my taste so I added a bit more mayo and mustard.  I served it with green beans and garlic bread.

My family loved it, especially the babies. I will definitely do this again.

Display Name:
amyehgee

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2358652.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Awesome! Anytime I'm missing a few ingredients I read through the reviews for ideas. This time I was missing the mushrooms, honey and italian seasoning. I did have Billy Bee's honey mustard, worcestershire sauce, garlic and lime juice. I only had about 15 mins to marinate the chicken and it still ended up nice and juicy.Maybe it helped that I pounded the chicken in the marinade. I also followed other's suggestions and grilled the chicken in the bacon fat before cooking it in the oven.Oh, and since I didn't do the mushrooms, I topped the chicken with minced onion and some paprika while frying it.There just didn't seem to be enough sauce, so after frying the chicken, I drained most of the bacon fat..leaving about a tblspn of fat and all the dried up bits of onion and chicken. To this I added about a cup of half and half, about two tsp. of honey mustard, a few good shakes of worcestershire and a few shakes of paprika. Heated on low, it thickened up on its own. My daughter hates sauce as a rule..but she liked this...oh and she doesn't like mustard either..I'm not sure on my measurements for the sauce as I'm totally an eyeballer. I imagine the mushrooms add another level of flavour, but this dish is yummy even without.

Great recipe!  I did not have honey or honey mustard.  So I used dijon mustard- 1/3 cup- and also added some brown sugar - 3T- as I did not have enough syrup either.  I used about some syrup too.  I used the bacon grease to cook the chicken and mushrooms.  I cooked the chicken for 15 min without cheese then another 10 with cheese- perfect!  I also did not have time to refrigerate the chicken with seasoning salt for 30 so I only let it sit while I made the sauce.

text:
I've been making this recipe for years, and absolutely love it. Prep time is a little longer but if you have the time I HIGHLY recommend it! The only changes I made was to use dijon mustard or course ground mustard and omitted the corn syrup. I pounded the breasts and seasoned with salt and pepper before frying. I also omitted the mushrooms because I am not a fan, but i'm sure if you are a mushroom fan I'm sure it would compliment the dish. Thanks again for sharing!!

I have been a little hesitant to make this recipe the last month, and now I feel very foolish. I made the small change by omitting the colby-jack Monterey cheese, as I feel cheese usually either makes or breaks a dish for me. That being said, the honey and mustard sauce was phenomenal, and I thought it was clever. I thought the smell from the mustard was overpowering when making it, but after tasting the sauce, my mind was blown. Tasted sweet and savory, and worked perfectly with the chicken. The bacon added a nice crunchiness to the chicken being so tender. Saut√©ed mushrooms always goes extremely well with chicken in my opinion. And I saut√©ed some seasoned asparagus in vegetable oil. I also omitted the corn starch, and added extra honey. Spectacular dish, and I will make it over and over again! Thanks so much!

Recipe has a good base but there is so much more to enhance the flavor. Slice a mixture of button mushrooms and shitake saut√© them in the bacon drippings.  Mushrooms are sponges they will take on the flavor of what your adding them to.  Medium small onion same thing slice or dice small add them to the mushrooms to give one more level of flavor add a little thyme leaves maybe a pinch of powdered rosemary. Serve this with Rosemary,Garlic oven roasted red potatoes and you have a 5 star dish.

text:
My family loves this recipe!  The only changes I made were I cooked fresh sliced sweet onion in the bacon fat and used onion powder- approx. 1 tbsp., instead of onion flakes in sauce. Browned chicken in bacon drippings with a dash of EVOO, poured 1/2 sauce over, layered mushrooms, bacon and cheese and put whole pan in oven for 15/20 min.  Last 5 min I added extra sauce so it was hot. Amazing! I always get compliments and requests to make it from friends coming over for dinner.

text:
Followed others' advice and marinated the chicken breasts in worcestershire sauce and garlic, then sauteed the mushroom slices in the bacon fat before browning the chicken breasts. Left out the corn syrup. The sauce made way too much, I reserved half of it as instructed, but we didn't feel it needed it when it came time to serve it. I'll only make half the sauce next time.

userID:
6988509
Display Name:
TaraB
