photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/954446.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Since chicken breasts are sold by the pound, not the breast, I always wonder why recipes don't tell you how many pounds to buy.  I decided to interpret this as 2 lbs.  You don't really need to pound them all the way down to 1/2 inch, but it's a good idea to pound them all out to the same thickness for even cooking.  I tried marinating them in Worcestershire sauce and garlic as some reviewers had mentioned, but didn't feel it added much and now stick to the seasoned salt.  For the sauce, I leave out the corn syrup and reduce the honey to 1/4 cup.  I also use Dijon mustard instead of yellow and onion powder instead of flakes.  I increase the mushrooms and use the whole 10 oz package.  I sautee them with garlic after browning the chicken breasts.
Review:
Rating:
5

text:
I was looking for a 'new' chicken recipe, one that I hadn't had yet and stumbled onto this one, Aussie Chicken. It was one of the best recipes I've tried from here and I only deviated from the recipe in 3 areas; I did not add corn syrup to the sauce, used 1/4 cup of dijon and 1/4 cup of yellow mustard and saute'd the chicken in the bacon grease left over. The result was great. Anytime you can add bacon to a recipe it's alright with me. This would also make a great sandwich.

text:
Delicious!  I changed it somewhat, but the essence of the original was tried.  I sprinkled my chicken breasts with Mrs. Dash chicken seasoning instead of seasoning salt and followed the recipe by putting them in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.  I also browned the chicken breasts in the bacon grease (I know that's not healthy, but it saved me from dirtying another pan. I left out the corn syrup and onion flakes and added horseradish and lemon juice to the honey mustard sauce (because that's how I make my honey mustard), and no one in the family likes mushrooms, so those were omitted.  I also put the cheese on the chicken breasts during the last five minutes of cooking because I didn't want it to get hard.  My two picky daughters enjoyed this dish, and anything they both eat is a hit in my house! Thanks, Beckie, for sharing.

I made this for a special family dinner and it got rave reviews!  I did use the corn syrup, although not as much, to thicken the sauce a little. It was definitely different from what we are used to eating. The change up in flavor made it quite interesting, and we enjoyed it. I would make some changes, as other reviewers have suggested. My husband enjoyed the recipe as I made it, but I think it will be a 5 star the next time I make itwith the adjustments .

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
just tried this recipe today.  wow - flavors just burst on the palate.  normally one piece of chicken breast is not going to fill me but this had me almost forcing that last bite.

fried the bacon first, then used the drippings to saute the mushrooms, then in the same skillet browned the chicken (6 breasts, 3 pounds).  followed the recipe for the honey mustard sauce, which ended up with too much (going to use the leftover sauce for almost any next cooking adventure - love that flavor).  placed the breasts in a baking dish, spooned the sauce over them, then layered in the mushrooms (probably 2 - 3 cups raw before the sauteing), the bacon and monterey jack cheese (not nearly the amount called for), baked in a toaster over at 350 for 15 minutes covered with tin foil, then another 15 minute uncovered.

wonderful......

I tell you what... this was a FANTASTIC recipe! The only changes I made was to brown the chicken in the bacon grease instead of vegetable oil; used Dark Karo syrup instead of light corn syrup; Portabella mushrooms, and brown mustard instead of yellow. Very minor changes really. My kids don't like mushrooms; however, they just devoured this recipe - mushrooms and all! VERY VERY FLAVORFUL! Everyone absolutely loved it. I would highly recommend to even the most discerning of pallets!

This was exceptional.  I cooked a package of bacon and then quickly seared the chicken breasts in the bacon fat before putting them in the oven.  I also sauteed the mushrooms in the bacon fat/chicken juice before spooning them over the chicken smothered in the mustard sauce. There was a delicious sauce in the bottom of the pan when the chicken was done cooking, so I spooned that over quinoa and served asparagus as my veggie.  Thank you so much for sharing.

text:
I made this last night, and cooking the bacon beforehand was a huge mistake.  I fried it up like normal, but then throwing it in the oven for another 15 minutes burned it, and it formed a hat of cheese, bacon and mushrooms that could be removed entirely from the chicken.  It was too crunchy and black.  I was embarassed in front of my boyfriend and roommate.  Hopefully, they'll eat dinner with me again, and I will put the raw bacon directly on the mushrooms and chicken.  Otherwise, this recipe was great!  No corn syrup either, didn't have that, didn't need it.

WOW!  and I'm not a fan of mustard.  I don't know if something was going on with my computer or the website the day I made this dish, but I couldn't read the reviews ( which I use for cooking hints, tips and substitutions). So,  I didn't use corn syrup and I browned the chicken and sauteed the mushrooms slightly in the bacon grease.  I also wound up using Kraft shredded Mexican 4 cheese for topping.  Yum Yum is all I can say.  My husband agreed and he's quite picky.   Served with asparagus sauteed in the bacon drippings with a bit of Balsamic vinegar and mashed potatoes.  Definitely a keeper recipe.

text:
I've been making this recipe for the past 5 years and my husband still loves it.  I use this exact recipe  except I make additional sauce for leftovers and fry the bacon, mushrooms, and chicken in the same skillet.  Don't leave out the honey or corn syrup.  Those are the ingredients that make this recipe so delicious.  I also make 2 cups of cooked rice that I put in the bottom of the baking dish and then cover with the chicken and most of sauce.  Excellent one-dish meal!

This is a very delicious dish.   I made it exactly as the recipe called with a couple of minor exceptions.   I left out the corn syrup from the dressing and made sure I used a higher end mustard instead of standard yellow. text:
We liked this a lot.  I messed up and used way too much seasoned salt on the chicken, my fault entirely--I just made it again and did not season the chicken at all, I did dip it in egg and then lightly flour before cooking which made it even better.  Every ingredient - including the bacon (second time around I used low sodium bacon which was a better choice), has ample salt in it so I would definitely cut back.  Excellent flavors, this was really delicious, in spite of my overseasoning it.  And I am not a no-salt freak.  I love spicy, well seasoned dishes, but this one absolutely did not need any extra.  Got rave reviews the second time. This is perfect for a buffet, or entertaining friends. Delicious and is very appealing visually as well.

Display Name:
Kimberly White Moore
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5845430.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I have to say that I was suprisingly pleased.  Not a huge fan of some honey mustard recipes. It got rave reviews from everyone!! I agreed with everyone else about the corn syrup.  I fixed it without it tasted and decided that it didn't need it. And to die down the sweetness of the honey added an extra 2 tablespoon of Mayo and using a whisk it turned out great. Would be great over salads as well :)  I also did as everyone suggested and used the Montreal steak seasoning by McCormick and had an idea and added a little bit of Smokehouse maple by McCormick as well. I think what knocks this over the top was it was so juicy. By searing it till its golden on both sides and cooking it for 15mins in oven then I flipped added more sauce and let it go again for a few minutes.  Then added the toppings and waited just till the cheese melted.  Everyone was asking me for the recipe.  And I have to say it is very appealing to look at too!

text:
this was wonderful.  I didn't follow the recipe to a "T," though I should have.  My honeymustard sauce needed a little more sweetness, but I took advice from others to leave out the syrup stuff.  Get good quality bacon; mine wasn't quality because i let my husband get it from the grocery store...'el cheapo!  The chicken was moist and very, very tasty.  it reminded me of OUtback a little.  My picky son ate 1 1/2 breasts; he skipped out on the sauce.  I cooked everything separately before assemblying the chicken.  For instance, i good the mushrooms in a little evoo, then I backed the bacon in the oven to get a desired crunchiness.  I didn't have shredded cheese, only sliced deli cheese, but it was good just the same.

text:
Very good!!! I had experienced a number of flops with a similar recipe, so I am thrilled that this was "the one"!  I reduced the honey to 1/4 cup and kept the corn syrup.  This was a great honey mustard sauce.  I also marinaded the chicken (dale's sauce & lemon juice) and browned the chicken in the bacon grease for flavor.  Cooked the chicken 15 minutes, then added the cheese, then baked 10 minutes more.  Thank you for a great recipe!

text:
Great flavor combination!  As suggested by others, I left the corn syrup out of the honey mustard sauce, and we didn't miss it (my husband is allergic to corn syrup).  I also used Worcestershire sauce and minced garlic with the seasoned salt to "kick up" the marinade a little.  To save dishes, I used the same skillet to fry the bacon, then saute the mushrooms (in bacon drippings; not sure why the recipe seems to indicate they would go into the 9x13 dish raw . . .), then brown the chicken (also in drippings).  Baked for 15 min. as indicated.  Delicious!

Oooooh Yeah...this is a keeper!  I can't wait to serve this to company.  I used monterrey jack cheese and it was fabulous!  I cooked the bacon (one slice per piece of chicken) in the microwave and crumbled it before topping the chicken with it.  I sauteed the mushrooms in a little olive oil/butter mixture and removed them before browning the chicken (which I marinated with a little worcestershire and sprinkled with seasoned salt).  I did not use the corn syrup per others reviews.  From there I assembled as directed.  Great recipe!

text:
Phenomenal!! This is one of the best chicken dinners I have ever made. My husband who is a big meat and potatoes kind of guy absolutely loves it. Everyone that comes over and eats this always leaves with the recipe. This what I do differently (I never have been one to follow directions,lol):
1. I use honey mustard to begin with then follow the directions as normal(I am not a bid yellow mustard fan). 
2. I cook the bacon first in a frying pan, then cook the chicken in the same frying pan.
3. Sometimes I omit the mushrooms (husbands not a bid fan of them) but is great with them too(I put them on half, I happen to love them).
No matter how you make this dish, it is wonderful.... Kudos for this recipe, thanks for sharing.

Display Name:
MrsJPS

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/75060.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Very rich and very delicious!  I didn't pound out the chicken but it turned out fine regardless.  Instead of the seasoning salt, I marinaded the chicken in some worcestershire sauce, lime juice, garlic, and a little prepared honey mustard.  I halved the sauce and didn't reserve any for dipping.  Instead of yellow mustard I used dijon honey mustard, no corn syrup, only half the honey called for, and no onion flakes because I don't have any.  I used an 8 oz. can of mushrooms instead of fresh, and cheddar cheese instead of the blend, and I also skipped the parsley garnish.  I took reviewer advice and used the bacon drippings to brown the chicken, which turned out great.  This struck me as a recipe that would be very hard to mess up, easily modified without major consequences, and delicious virtually no matter what.  I'll make this again for future high-fat splurge dinners. ;)

text:
Very Good Recipe.  I sauted butterflied chicken (instead of pounding) in the bacon fat for flavor.  I only added 1/8 cup of corn syrup and used low fat mayo in the sauce.  The sauce is definately more a sweeter honey mustard than a mustardy honey mustard.  I would suggest dijon instead of yellow mustard if you prefer the later and skip the corn starch.  I only used 1 cup of cheese (and I love cheese) but I think that was plenty.  Will make again.

text:
This is my husband's favorite dish at a certain eatery. He thought I got take out from there tonight. I never order chicken at a steakhouse so my opinion is different. I thought this was way too salty. It was good but I couldn't get through 1 piece. I made it with boneless thighs rather than breasts. I left out the corn syrup per another cook's suggestion. Also, there is no need to bake this dish. I did it all in one skillet and covered at the end to simulate the oven step. There is a lot less to clean up afterwards this way. I used bacon drippings for the oil also. Next time I will make it with 1/2 the seasoned salt maybe less.

text:
I have made this recipe numerous times now.  This is definately my "go to recipe" when I'm entertaining people I want to impress.  The recipe is rather expensive if you are cooking for a lot of people, but well worth every penny.  EVERY time I make it I get raving revues from EVERYONE, then I have to share the recipe (maybe I should just keep copies on hand).  The best part is that it's easy to make and prep ahead of time.  I like to get everything ready up until the point of putting it in the oven, then place dish in the fridge to finish baking right before dinner.  Trust me, if you need to impress for dinner ... you will not go wrong with this one!

This recipe is great!  I made this for some dinner guests and they raved about it.  I made it just as it is written but served it with choice of the honey mustard sauce or ranch dressing. The mustard sauce was a little sweet but my hubby loved it and ate the leftover sauce on many things, including dipping his pretzels in them.

text:
3 years now I've been coming back to this recipe to print it out, because someone steals my copy after I cook it. I know the restaurant that this recipe is mimmicking, and if it's not exact, then it's so close that no one can tell the difference.  My sister still believes that the sauce has a hint of cinammon in it, and while I'm still not convinced.. she always adds a dash o'cinnamon to it, and never gets a negative comment.  My only advise on this recipe is that you better make double the sauce, cuz it's so good that everyone will want double.. and then you can use the sauce later in the week for something else.

text:
I followed the advice of many to use dijon mustard and I omitted the corn syrup.  In omitting the corn syrup, I found the dish to be tasty and it produced just the right amount of 'sauce'. Any extra honey mustard sauce can be used for salads or dipping.

This dish was very good for something different, however it was too tangy to have all the time. 

I recommend putting more cheese on top than the recipe calls for, but my family is a bunch of cheese-a-holics.

text:
It's good, but it's rich and kind of greasy.  No mushrooms, so left those out.  Also left out the corn syrup. I think that would make the sauce way too runny and sweet.  And why dilute the honey?  Used spicy mustard in the sauce and the sauce was definitely the best part.  Browned the chicken in a little of the bacon grease.  The cheese and bacon tend to want to slide off the chicken, especially as everything cools.  Again, it was pretty good, but not for everynight eating if you want to stay healthy!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
The only reason I am not giving this 5 stars is the calories but it is a great recipe.  As suggested a few times below, I omitted the corn syrup in the sauce and did not miss a thing.  In fact, if I did add it, i bet it would have been too sweet.  I browned the chicken in the same pan after I fried the bacon then I sauteed the mushrooms in the bacon and chicken reserves.  This gave lots of flavor and less to clean up.  In addition, this dish is great for a dinner party - I was able to assemble in the morning and heared up in the oven 1/2 hour before dinner.  (As suggested by others, I increased cook time to 1/2 hour).  Great recipe.

I needed a quick way to cook chicken, and was delighted with this recipe.  My kids loved it, and so did I.  I didn't have time to salt and let sit for 30 min, but that didn't seem to matter.  I added the season salt as I browned th e chicken.  Left off the mushrooms, as we don't care for them.  Also broke the bacon into pieces to top the chicken, which made it easier to cut/serve.  It did make more sauce than we needed for 6 breasts, probably could make 8-10 chicken breasts and still have enough sauce.

text:
Great recipe. I do a few things differently but no matter what its a great taste. I have never actually done the whole seasoning salt thing, mostly because its just something I dont have in my spice cabinet. I filet my chicken instead of pounding it and I cook my bacon in the microwave (every package wil let you know how to do this if you have never done it before). By fileting and microwaving the bacon, it really cuts down on the mess. Regardless, its delicious and you gotta give it a try!

This chicken looked great, if nothing else. I really liked the honey mustard sauce aswell and I have some left overs for sandwiches etc. I made one huge mistake though: I like dark meat so I bought some chicken thighs instead. Unfortunatley I didn't remove the skin so it became very greasy and difficult to eat. It might be great if you don't make my mistake but I probably wont try this again. Thanks anyway!

text:
I def. LOVE this!!! 
One of the best recipes I have found. I did make some modefications...
I fried the bacon on the stove top, then used the bacon grease to cook the mushrooms on high heat. It gaved the mushroms a bacon taste to it. I put together the recipe as normal and added green onions for flavor and color. I finished it off with Mozzarella cheese and a little of Light Cheddar.
Sides, I nice crispy salad with honey mustand dressing, tomatoe and basil tear and share bread and couscous.

No honey?  No bacon?  No onion flakes?  No Problem.  I was missing three of these ingredients but I used a few substitutions and it turned out delicsious!  Instead of honey I used a half cup of dark brown sugar with 3T of water.  Instead of bacon I used bacon bits and since it was around Thanksgiving instead of using dried onion flakes I sprinkled some crushed french fried onions!  It turned out awesome!

reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674156.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this for a dinner party of 12. It was a BIG hit. I tripled the recipe, so I my total amount of mustard was 1 cup; I substituted 1/3 of this with Dijon mustard. It gave it a nice kick.  I lightly browned the chicken the night before and cooked the mushrooms.  I marinated the browned chicken in some of the sauce overnight. When it came time to cooking the chicken, I placed it on a cookie sheet and cooked it until almost done. Then I put the toppings on and continued cooking it until cheese was melted. It was easy and delicious. I warmed up the sauce and served it on the side.  My guests were practically drink it!  Thanks you for the recipe!

text:
This is quite probably the best way to prepare chicken.  Save time by slicing through the chicken breast to the appropriate thickness instead of pounding it. By precooking the seasoned chicken pieces and freezing them; and doing the same with the bacon, you've got the makings for a really quick meal.
Grated fresh onion works as well as dried flakes, and any cheddar works.
MY, this is a good recipe!

text:
This recipe was truly a hit in my house! My husband loved it and I ate it two days in a row. It was even better today...I
I actually lightened up the recipe when I made it only because I am watching my calories. I used 4 chicken breasts but I used 3 slices of low fat Turkey bacon, light mayo, 1 cup of cheese, tons more mushrooms, added some onions, didn't use the oil, and used only half the amounts of corn syrup, mayo and honey. It still turned out DELICOUS!
 I put it over a Ceasar Salad with homemade croutons with the leftovers today for lunch and it was wonderful.
Great recipe!

text:
There is nothing like deciding to make a recipe, then not having the proper ingredients in your pantry!  As others suggested--this recipe is great wihtout substitutions--but with the following alterations, it turned out great and is an easy to fix weeknight meal.  I used whole grain balsamic mustard instead of prepared and I used boysenberry syrup since I was out of corn syrup--I also used bagged 5 blend cheese and chicken tenders instead of breast..great recipe!

text:
I made this recipe for a dinner party and everyone loved it!  I did do a few things differently from the recipe. I cooked the bacon in the microwave, faster and less grease.  I also cooked the chicken on my George Forman grill instead of pan frying them, they were still very moist and it took very little time to cook.  I also sauted my mushrooms before assembling the chicken dish.  We saved the extra honey mustard and my daughter used it to dip chicken tenders in later that week.

text:
This was very good! Will save this for an occasional treat. Sits pretty heavy.  I cooked 2 breasts for hubby and myself, so I halved everything.  Also used only 1/4 of the sauce.  I made this in one pan.  Cooked the chicken in bacon grease, didn't notice the flavor to be over powering, but I love bacon.  Clean up and preparation were extremely easy.  Had no problem with 15 minute cooking time since the breasts are pounded thin, and pre-cooked.  May take longer if you don't pound the chicken to 1/2" thickness?  VERY GOOD. GO AHEAD AND TRY IT.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Wonderful - absolutely WONDERFUL!  My husband (whose a picky eater) loved this.  I'm in England and I've never heard of light corn syrup so I used golden syrup instead.  I also used half French's burger mustard and half English mustard (the very hot kind). Taking the recommendation of other cooks I reduced the bacon to 1 slice per chicken breast and chopped it up.  I also sauted the sliced mushrooms with a quarter of a finely chopped onion and one small crushed garlic clove.  I used a strong cheddar cheese and it wasn't overpowering. (You can't get the recommended cheese over here).  This will be a very regular guest at our dinner table.  Served with buttered new potatoes and broccoli.

country:
None
text:
I was disappointed that this recipe didn't turn out as wonderful as I expected from the reviews.  The topping on the chicken was the best part -- I sauteed the mushrooms and onion (instead of onion flakes) in the bacon grease, and it was delicious with the bacon and cheese.  I found the honey mustard sauce too cloying, so next time I will use my favorite honey mustard recipe, which makes the chicken very flavorful and tender: 1/2 c. honey, 1/2 c. dijon mustard, 2 T. lemon juice, 1 t. salt.  This marinade works best if you completely oven-bake the chicken, without pan-frying first.  (Add the toppings during the last 15 minutes.)

text:
This is a good recipe.  i was looking for something different i could try using chicken breasts.  I have made this twice with only moderate changes: no seasoning salt or refrigeration prior to cooking chicken, no dried onion flakes, substituted light brown sugar for honey(I was out), and no cheese(once) and the dish was still good.  I've also used the dressing recipe with homemade chicken strips.  My family devoured them!!
I will definately add to my recipe box.

Thanks!!

text:
Awesome chicken recipe.  I made this for my brother's birthday dinner and everyone loved it.  While I will give this 5 stars, next time (and it will be soon) I'm going to use a honey mustard recipe for this same chicken that I have found on a couple of other sites - dijon mustard, honey, veg. oil, lemon juice...just to see how it tastes.  Will make again and again!  Thanks.

Funny story here. When I added and mixed the mayo to the sauce with a fork, all I saw was white tiny lumps floating in the  mixture. I'm thinking,"Oh no, I messed this one up." LOL..However, I used a blender and the mayo disolved. I used 1/4c of mustard because the original recipe's amount made the mustard taste too strong. This chicken is really good but I will only make it once a year because it is tooooooooooooo fattening. All I can think of while eating it was clogged arteries. Again, it really taste good if you want to gain some weight.

text:
Yum!  I wasn't sure what to serve at my dinner party, but I'm glad I picked this one!  Everyone loved it!  The honey mustard sauce really gives this chicken a suprise kick, great flavor.  If you like mushrooms, you can really pile them on because they shrink down quite a bit during cooking. I also cooked the bacon the night before in the oven (on a cookie sheet at 425 about 20 min.).  This helped cut down on time & grease during initial preparation.  Whole operation was a little time consuming, but end result well worth it. I'll definatly be making this one again.  Thanks for a great recipe!

With my picky 5 kids this is a winner.  Grown-up taste that even kids like.  I do make some changes.  I use Oscar Mayer real bacon bits to save time.  I skip the mushrooms, use less cheese(just cover the top of the chicken), and do not usually have any sauce to reserve.  One of the kids often requests no sauce (just bacon and cheese).  Everyone is happy!

Hello! Ive rated this recipe before and this is still my all-time favorite! I wanted to see what other people thought of it and a few mentioned about having too much sauce, what you do with that extra sauce is pour it over another dish such as potatoes, i highly reccommend roasted garlic apple potatoes which can be found here as well. Pour the leftover sauce from the aussie chicken onto the potatoes....it is to die for! I usually have to make a bit more sauce than usual because everyone puts it on their potatoes as well!

text:
I find one or two new recipes a year that get me a big thumbs up from my husband - and one worked.
Very delicious, though I did have to cook it for longer than the suggested time.  My 15 month old son couldn't get enough of it either :)
I prepared the honey mustard sauce,browned the chicken, sliced the mushrooms and cooked the bacon ahead of time.  So when dinner time came, I only had to assemble and put it in the oven - which works well for those whose supper time is the busiest time!
